The figure in front of gat=
e frowned as he lowered his axe, obviously
getting into a battle stance. =
=93You dare insult us!=94 He said in a low
growl, you will die for your ins=
olence!=94

The figure stood perhaps seven and a half feet tall at the top =
of his
horn, his shoulders wide and massive hinting at his great strength. =
He
spread his feet apart as his he brought his large axe into a ready
posit=
ion.

=93No Firehorn!=94 came a female voice that was somehow almost right =
next
to WHEELIE =93He bear=92s the signature of the other who came through =
here
he must pass.=94

A female seemed to almost melt out of the jungle=92s=
 brush line and on
to the path, standing at nearly the same height as the o=
ther she
looked much like FIREHORN only with a slight difference in colorat=
ion
and of course she had a more feminine build to her.

=93Astra you ask f=
or much.=94 FIREHORN said, obviously ready for battle.

ASTRA turned to loo=
k at WHEELIE, =93Why is it that you seek for death
when it was not our desi=
re to give it?=94 She looked genuinely confused.

There was a grunt from FI=
REHORN, =93Perhaps his brains are addled, you
hear his strange speech.=94 H=
e straightened, but kept his axe still
before him. "The other did not speak=
 this way."

The strange thing about all of this is that niether figure was=
